description: A out-of-bounds write vulnerability in Fortinet FortiOS SSL VPN allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code or command via specially crafted HTTP requests.
mitigation: Update to FortiOS 7.4.3, 7.2.7, or 7.0.14. If patching is not immediately possible, disable SSL VPN.

description: A command injection vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall.
mitigation: Apply vendor hotfix immediately. Enable Threat Prevention signatures. Consider disabling GlobalProtect if not required.

description: ConnectWise ScreenConnect authentication bypass vulnerability allows an attacker to access the administrative interface without authentication.
mitigation: Update to ScreenConnect 23.9.8 or later immediately. Cloud-hosted instances are automatically updated.

description: Authentication bypass vulnerability in JetBrains TeamCity allows a remote attacker to take administrative control of the TeamCity server.
mitigation: Update to TeamCity 2023.11.4 or later. Apply the security patch plugin if update is not possible.

description: Jenkins arbitrary file read vulnerability through the CLI allows attackers to read arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system.
mitigation: Update to Jenkins 2.442 or LTS 2.426.3. Disable CLI if not needed.

description: Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure authentication bypass vulnerability allows remote attackers to access restricted resources.
mitigation: Apply vendor patches. Implement additional network segmentation for VPN concentrators.

description: GoAnywhere MFT authentication bypass vulnerability allows unauthorized access to the admin console and file transfer capabilities.
mitigation: Update to GoAnywhere MFT 7.1.1 or 6.8.3. Restrict access to admin console from trusted networks only.

description: Cisco ASA and FTD denial of service vulnerability in the management and VPN web server allows remote attackers to cause a reload of the device.
mitigation: Apply Cisco security advisory patches. Limit access to management interfaces.
